guide.introduction: In the summer, I drink my coffee almost exclusively iced. I stick the whole brewed pot in the fridge and mix in sugar and milk on a cup-by-cup basis. But why doesn't granulated sugar dissolve well in my iced coffee? Just remember back to chemistry and physics: slower-moving molecules in the cold liquid don't bounce around and react with the sugar as quickly or as energetically as in a hot cup o' joe. I'm going to show you how to exploit this principle in the opposite direction. By combining heated water with an equal quantity of sugar, a concentrated solution is formed that holds true upon cooling. This new liquid substance has all the same sweetness of granulated sugar, but will mix easily into ice coffees and teas. Read on to make your own simple syrup.

Just remember back to chemistry and physics: slower-moving molecules in the cold liquid don't bounce around and react with the sugar as quickly or as energetically as in a hot cup o' joe. I'm going to show you how to exploit this principle in the opposite direction. By combining heated water with an equal quantity of sugar, a concentrated solution is formed that holds true upon cooling. This new liquid substance has all the same sweetness of granulated sugar, but will mix easily into ice coffees and teas. Read on to make your own simple syrup.

Relevant parts
  • Granulated sugar
  • Water
Tools
  • Measuring cup
  • Saucepan
  • Squeeze bottle
  • Stove

lines.text: Gather 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup granulated sugar and combine in a saucepan or microwave-safe dish.
lines.text_raw: Gather 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup granulated sugar and combine in a saucepan or microwave-safe dish.

lines.text: Apply medium heat or stick the mixture in the microwave. Stir the mixture until all the sugar is dissolved. Don't let it get hot enough to boil, and remove from heat promptly. Let the solution cool to room temperature.
lines.text_raw: Apply medium heat or stick the mixture in the microwave. Stir the mixture until all the sugar is dissolved. Don't let it get hot enough to boil, and remove from heat promptly. Let the solution cool to room temperature.

lines.text: Use a funnel to transfer the syrup to a bottle for convenient dispensing. Mine's brown because I used unrefined sugar, but yours might be clear.

lines.text: Add to your drinks to taste. Store it in the fridge.

guide.summary: Make a simple sugar solution to add to your iced coffee and tea.
guide.title: Simple Syrup for Iced Drinks
